sage makers a service that gives data

let's let data scientists focus on data

maker is a rich service but at its core

API call
sage maker comes with a set of pre-built

to your business sage maker algorithms
are designed to run on web scale

sage maker also comes with pre-built

the customer can invoke their training

training sage maker handles the setup

almost all algorithms have hyper

getting the right set of hyper

with sage makers automatic model tuning
you can let sage maker do the work of

once you have trained a model you want

this vastly simplifies the deployment of

you can apply your model to existing

intrinsic to the way sage maker works

share a common isolation architecture
there are slight differences between

architecture our service account owns a
virtual private cloud network or VPC
that is isolated from anything else
going on in AWS and everything else that
is managed the sage maker control plane
for the particular service that you're

the control plane is the part of sage
maker which runs all the setup and
teardown and monitoring of specific jobs
or instances when you call the sage
maker API eventually as part of that
calls are generated that gets sent to
the control plane which will do all the
work of provisioning your environment
and making sure it's running in the
correct way so you have a secure manage
VPC that's only accessible to our
control plane each job or notebook it's
a fresh ec2 instance so we don't reuse
instances we create new ones that are
completely reset the same way as if ec2
instance would be if you were just using
the regular Amazon ec2 API and each one
is for a single job or single notebook
instances no other jobs from your
account or other accounts will run on
those instances many organizations have
isolation requirements even within the
same AWS account and we respect that we
take advantage of the really elastic
nature of ec2 to give us a completely
secure infrastructure then we create
Network isolation between these imagine
I'm running for example a training job
on an ec2 instance that got allocated
for me and you are in the same cluster
running your own
trainee job our jobs can't access each
other at all and this is protected with
AWS security groups they're
automatically configured so the only
place that the nodes can talk to is to

we'll see an advanced version of this

counts

we want these ec2 instances within your

with this architecture the members of
